list_definition.definition: to cause feelings of dislike or sickness in

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The smell of that soup disgusts me
She was disgusted by your behaviour/behavior.

list_definition.definition: the state or feeling of being disgusted

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She left the room in disgust.

list_ex_of_english: As soon as most dealers actually knew anything, they would get disgusted with what they had been doing, and wanted out.
She told me that she was disgusted by what she saw.
We have been shocked and disgusted by their attitude.
There were disgusted nods, but little sense of sympathy from either.

He reviews evidence that humans can categorize facial expressions into the categories happy, sad, fearful, angry, surprised, and disgusted, and that this categorization may operate similarly in different cultures.
I am afraid that we on this side are rather disgusted by the manner in which this proposal has been disposed of.
The normal person may be ir ritated or disgusted when seeing someone disrobing on the bus, but he or she is unlikely to suffer such impairments.
All over this country, people representing all the major parties will be disgusted by the fact that these questions are being treated as trivial.
